channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12563] After Starting up mini hbase cluster, Real Configuration of Cluster never set to HBaseTestingUtility
item.description: When I use startMiniHBaseCluster method. It starts up a Mini Cluster for the tests. While starting It changes some configuration. For example Master's port or Region Server's. After Cluster starting We should set its new configuration to HbaseTestingUtils conf.
item.summary: After Starting up mini hbase cluster, Real Configuration of Cluster never set to HBaseTestingUtility

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
Hi Nick Dimiduk,

You know the problem. Can you review my patch ? It should submit all branches.
Interesting. Makes sense Talat UYARER. You have a unit test to go with this patch? Add it to TestHBaseTestingUtility? Assert the master port works post-startup?
Thanks stack for fast reviewing. I did not expect the reviewing to be so fast Ok I will create a unit test for TestHBaseTestingUtility.

Hi stack

Actually we have some test case for master server port in TestInfoServers. I updated those in TestInfoServers code. Is it Ok ?

Why remove this configuration?

51 UTIL.getConfiguration().setInt(HConstants.MASTER_INFO_PORT, 0);
52 UTIL.getConfiguration().setInt(HConstants.REGIONSERVER_INFO_PORT, 0);

Now the ports are not ephemeral anymore?

And in the test you assert nothing? Shouldn't you at least assert you can get to the info port ui?

Thanks

Those are unnecessary. They are set when you are starting MiniHBaseCluster. You can look at LocalHBaseCluster

I updated configuration object. And I reach the info ui on defined port with the tests. If I can reach to the info ui on updated configuration port, Is not it enough ?

You added no asserts to the tests? They worked before you made your change, is that right? If so, is there a test you can add that fails before your code change and passes after.

Fair enough on removing the explicit setting of ports to 0.

I added a test that check master info port. If I close improvements, All test will be failed.

BTW MASTER_INFO_PORT does not set anywhere. I overlooked it. Because of that I add again that line. I just removed REGIONSERVER_INFO_PORT

Pushed to 0.98+ Thanks for the patch Talat UYARER

What is the below about? Seems unnecessary? I just left it in.


  9 +    // Cluster confguration should set HbaseTestingUtility Conf

 10 +    MiniHBaseCluster miniHBaseCluster = (MiniHBaseCluster) this.hbaseCluster;

 11 +    this.conf = miniHBaseCluster.getMaster().getConfiguration();

Hi stack When you start up test minicluster we overwrite port configuration after starting up. Because of this HbaseTestingUtility's configuration object is different with configuration of the cluster. You can check with hbase.regionserver.info.port. you will see both of them have different port number. So I set master's configuration to HbaseTestingUtility's.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5823 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5823/)
HBASE-12563 After Starting up mini hbase cluster, Real Configuration of Cluster never set to HBaseTestingUtility (Talat UYARER) (stack: rev 9be143691c6b84201fc49b9de040686fab155b48)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/TestInfoServers.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/HBaseTestingUtility.java

I was asking why bother with the local variable when we have a data member this.hbaseCluster? Do...

this.conf = ((MiniHBaseCluster) this.hbaseCluster).getMaster().getConfiguration();

... but its not important... just was asking.

This seems to have broke the build: https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/HBase-TRUNK/5823/testReport/

Git bisect identifies it as breakage. Here is the script I used:

mvn clean install test -Dtest=TestZooKeeper -PskipIntegrationTests

... TestZooKeeper was failing.
Did git revert from branch-1 and from master branch.

I am confused little bit. If you can help me I will be glad.
When I use HBaseTestingUtility#startMiniCluster with 2 master and 3 slave. Every nodes have different info ports because of they works on same machine. How can I learn their info port without Configuration object ?

Talat UYARER Their info port is in zk IIRC. If for unit tests, you could iterate the running daemons – you can get the set from the minihbasecluster instance – and this way ask each daemon what their info port is?
